dict.string: An increase in the severity of a wound caused by friction.
Any cause, physical or mental, that restricts the ability to move.
Any cause that blocks or hinders the act of pouring through or over; especially the passage of a fluid through the vessels of a specific organ. (7)
Any cause that blocks or hinders the function of a sense (eg, sight, hearing, smell, etc.)
A condition affecting the musculoskeletal systems and thereby impairing the patient's mobility.
A neurological condition that increases a patient's risk of contracting a wound or hindering the healing of a wound
A condition tht impairs perfusion in body tissue
Pain that cannot be or is not effectively controlled with medication of other interventions.
